Multiview dataset managementÂ¶

class DatasetÂ¶

This is the base class for all the type of multiview datasets of SuMMIT.

get_shape(view_index=0, sample_indices=None)Â¶

Gets the shape of the needed view on the asked samples

Parameters:
  • view_index (int) â The index of the view to extract
  • sample_indices (numpy.ndarray) â The array containing the indices of the samples to extract.
Returns:
Return type:

Tuple containing the shape
init_sample_indices(sample_indices=None)Â¶

If no sample indices are provided, selects all the available samples.

Parameters:sample_indices (np.array,) â An array-like containing the indices of the samples.
to_numpy_array(sample_indices=None, view_indices=None)Â¶

Concatenates the needed views in one big numpy array while saving the limits of each view in a list, to be able to retrieve them later.

Parameters:
  • sample_indices (array like) â The indices of the samples to extract from the dataset
  • view_indices (array like) â The indices of the view to concatenate in the numpy array
Returns:

  • concat_views (numpy array,) â The numpy array containing all the needed views.
  • view_limits (list of int) â The limits of each slice used to extract the views.
class HDF5Dataset(views=None, labels=None, are_sparse=False, file_name='dataset.hdf5', view_names=None, path='', hdf5_file=None, labels_names=None, is_temp=False, sample_ids=None)Â¶

Dataset class

This is used to encapsulate the multiview dataset while keeping it stored on the disk instead of in RAM.

Parameters:
  • views (list of numpy arrays or None) â The list containing each view of the dataset as a numpy array of shape (nb samples, nb features).
  • labels (numpy array or None) â The labels for the multiview dataset, of shape (nb samples, ).
  • are_sparse (list of bool, or None) â The list of boolean telling if each view is sparse or not.
  • file_name (str, or None) â The name of the hdf5 file that will be created to store the multiview dataset.
  • view_names (list of str, or None) â The name of each view.
  • path (str, or None) â The path where the hdf5 dataset file will be stored
  • hdf5_file (h5py.File object, or None) â If not None, the dataset will be imported directly from this file.
  • labels_names (list of str, or None) â The name for each unique value of the labels given in labels.
  • is_temp (bool) â Used if a temporary dataset has to be stored by the benchmark.
datasetÂ¶

The h5py file pbject that points to the hdf5 dataset on the disk.

Type:h5py.File object
nb_viewÂ¶

The number of views in the dataset.

Type:int
view_dictÂ¶
The dictionnary with the name of each view as the keys and their indices
as values
Type:dict
get_label_names(decode=True, sample_indices=None)Â¶

Used to get the list of the label names for the given set of samples

Parameters:
  • decode (bool) â If True, will decode the label names before listing them
  • sample_indices (numpy.ndarray) â The array containing the indices of the needed samples
Returns:

  • list
  • seleted labelsâ names

  • sample_indices (numpy.ndarray) â The array containing the indices of the samples to extract.

Method used to delete the dataset file on the disk if the dataset is temporary.

to_numpy_array(sample_indices=None, view_indices=None)Â¶

Concatenates the needed views in one big numpy array while saving the limits of each view in a list, to be able to retrieve them later.

Parameters:
  • sample_indices (array like) â The indices of the samples to extract from the dataset
  • view_indices (array like) â The indices of the view to concatenate in the numpy array
Returns:

  • concat_views (numpy array,) â The numpy array containing all the needed views.
  • view_limits (list of int) â The limits of each slice used to extract the views.

to_numpy_array(sample_indices=None, view_indices=None)Â¶

Concatenates the needed views in one big numpy array while saving the limits of each view in a list, to be able to retrieve them later.

Parameters:
  • sample_indices (array like) â The indices of the samples to extract from the dataset
  • view_indices (array like) â The indices of the view to concatenate in the numpy array
Returns:

  • concat_views (numpy array,) â The numpy array containing all the needed views.
  • view_limits (list of int) â The limits of each slice used to extract the views.

get_samples_views_indices(dataset, samples_indices, view_indices)Â¶

This function is used to get all the samples indices and view indices if needed

init_multiple_datasets(path_f, name, nb_cores)Â¶

Used to create copies of the dataset if multicore computation is used.

This is a temporary solution to fix the sharing memory issue with HDF5 datasets.

Parameters:
  • path_f (string) â Path to the original dataset directory
  • name (string) â Name of the dataset
  • nb_cores (int) â The number of threads that the benchmark can use
Returns:

datasetFiles â Dictionary resuming which mono- and multiview algorithms which will be used in the benchmark.
Return type:

None
input_(timeout=15)Â¶

used as a UI to stop if too much HDD space will be used
